content.description: Let f be a function defined and continuous on the closed interval [a,b]. If f has a relative maximum at c and a<c<b, which of the following statements must be true?
content.question: I. f'(c) exists. II. If f'(c) exists, then f'(c)=0 III. If f''(c) exists, then <math> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>″</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>c</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </math>.

topic.text: 5.7: Using the Second Derivative Test to Determine Extrema

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
